The Dark Bootstrap template for the plotly figure.

impedance_spec_dash.CONFIG: dict = {'displaylogo': False, 'modeBarButtonsToRemove': ['select2d', 'lasso2d'], 'scrollZoom': True, 'toImageButtonOptions': {'filename': 'custom_image', 'format': 'svg', 'scale': 1}}¶

Dictionary describing the configuration of the plotly Figure object.

class impedance_spec_dash.DataBackend[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for the GUI backend.

Methods

__init__:

Method called when the class is initialized.

multimeterGetTemperature:

Method for the multimeter thread to get temperature from the VC 870 multimeter in Celsius.

resetFig:

Method to reset the plotly figure object.

addFigTraces:

Method to add new traces to a Plotly Figure object.

updatePlotData(fig: Figure, x_data: Series, y1_data: Series, y2_data: Series, pass_no: int) → Figure[source]¶

Method to update trace data in a plotly Figure.

Parameters:
figplotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly figure object on which the trace data is to be updated.

x_datapandas.Series

The series for the x axis data for the plots in the top row. In this case the Frequency in Hz.

y1_datapandas.Series

The series for the y axis data of the plot on the top-left. Usually the real part of impedance or permittivity. This will be the x axis of the plot in the bottom row.

y2_datapandas.Series

The series for the y axis data of the plot on the top-right. Usually the imaginary part of the impedance or permittivity. This will be the y axis data in the bottom plot.

pass_noint

Integer indicating the trace name that is to be selected to be updated.

Returns:
plotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly figure with the updated trace data.

  37BOOTSTRAP = pio.templates["bootstrap"]
  38BOOTSTRAP_DARK = pio.templates["bootstrap_dark"]
  39
  40
  41def modifyColorwayInPlotlyTemplate(template: go.layout.Template) -> go.layout.Template:
  42    """Method to modify the colorway of the plotly Figure. Needed to get the same color for the traces in the real, imaginary and cole-cole plot.
  43
  44    Parameters
  45    ----------
  46    template : plotly.graph_objects.layout.Template
  47        The plotly layout template to be modified.
  48
  49    Returns
  50    -------
  51    plotly.graph_objects.layout.Template
  52        The modified plotly layout template
  53    """
  54    colorway = template["layout"]["colorway"]
  55    mod_colorway = []
  56    for color in colorway:
  57        for i in range(0, 3):
  58            mod_colorway.append(color)
  59
  60    template["layout"]["colorway"] = mod_colorway
  61    return template
  62
  63
  64BOOTSTRAP = modifyColorwayInPlotlyTemplate(BOOTSTRAP)
  65"""The Bootstrap template for the plotly figure."""
  66BOOTSTRAP_DARK = modifyColorwayInPlotlyTemplate(BOOTSTRAP_DARK)
  67"""The Dark Bootstrap template for the plotly figure."""
  68
  69
  70class DataBackend:
  71    """Class for the GUI backend.
  72
  73    Methods
  74    -------
  75    __init__:
  76        Method called when the class is initialized.
  77    multimeterGetTemperature:
  78        Method for the multimeter thread to get temperature from the VC 870 multimeter in Celsius.
  79    resetFig:
  80        Method to reset the plotly figure object.
  81    addFigTraces:
  82        Method to add new traces to a Plotly Figure object.
  83    updatePlotData:
  84        Method to update trace data in a plotly Figure.
  85    startMeasurementThread:
  86        Method to start the required initialize and start the required measurement threads.
  87    runImpedanceMeasurement:
  88        Method for the impedance mode measurement.
  89    runPermittivityMeasurement:
  90        Method for the permittivity mode measurement.
  91    prepareForShutdown:
  92        Method called before shutting down the application.
  93    """
  94
  95    hp_4192a: HP4192A
  96    """The HP 4192A Impedance Analyzer resource on GPIB."""
  97
  98    meas_running: bool = False
  99    """Boolean indicating if a measurement is running."""
 100
 101    meas_cancelled: bool = False
 102    """Boolean indicating if a measurement was cancelled."""
 103
 104    meas_completed: bool = True
 105    """Boolean indicating if a measurement has finished."""
 106
 107    dataframe_data: pd.DataFrame
 108    """Pandas dataframe for the values during measurement."""
 109
 110    plot_data_frame: pd.DataFrame
 111    """Pandas dataframe with values for the plot update."""
 112
 113    meas_thread: threading.Thread
 114    """Thread object containing the required measurement function."""
 115
 116    temperature_thread: threading.Thread
 117    """Thread object containing the required temperature function."""
 118
 119    progress_current: int = 0
 120    """Integer indicating the current progress of the measurement. Required to update the progress bar on the web app."""
 121
 122    plot_fig: go.Figure
 123    """Plotly figure object containing the plot of the measurement."""
 124
 125    voltcraft_vc870_temperature: float
 126    """Temperature in Celsius recorded from the Voltcraft VC870 multimeter."""
 127
 128    def __init__(self) -> None:
 129        """Method called when the class is initialized."""
 130
 131        # ************HP 4192A***************
 132        # VISA setup
 133        # self.hp_4192a = hp4192a.HP4192A()
 134        self.plot_fig = self.resetFig(None)
 135        self.hp_4192a = HP4192A("GPIB0::1::INSTR")
 136        self.voltcraft_vc870_temperature = np.nan
 137        if self.hp_4192a.isConnected():
 138            self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(
 139                data_ready=1,
 140                zy_range=-1,
 141                high_speed=1,
 142                average=1,
 143                output_format=0,
 144                function_A=0,
 145                function_B=1,
 146                circuit_mode=0,
 147                trigger=0,
 148                osc_level=1.000,
 149                dc_bias=False,
 150                execute=True,
 151            )
 152            test = self.hp_4192a.readFromInstrument()
 153            if type(test[0]) is not float:
 154                print("Error in connected instrument.")
 155
 156        pass
 157
 158    def multimeterGetTemperature(self):
 159        """Method for the multimeter thread to get temperature from the VC 870 multimeter in Celsius."""
 160        # Get the directory of the Python script
 161        script_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
 162        sigrok_path = os.path.join(script_dir, "sigrok-cli", "sigrok-cli")  # Full path to the sigrock-cli executable
 163        sigrok_cmd = (
 164            f'"{sigrok_path}" -d voltcraft-vc870-ser:conn="hid/ch9325/raw=\\\\?\\hid#vid_1a86&pid_e008#6&36babeda&0&0000#'
 165            f'{{4d1e55b2-f16f-11cf-88cb-001111000030}}" --samples 1'
 166        )  # sigrok-cli command to be used. "sigrok-cli -d voltcraft-vc870-ser:conn="hid/ch9325/raw=\\?\hid#vid_1a86&pid_e008#6&36babeda&0&0000#{4d1e55b2-f16f-11cf-88cb-001111000030}" --samples 1"
 167        while self.meas_running:
 168            # Configure subprocess to prevent command window popup
 169            startupinfo = subprocess.STARTUPINFO()
 170            startupinfo.dwFlags |= subprocess.STARTF_USESHOWWINDOW  # Hides the command window
 171
 172            # Run the subprocess silently
 173            process = subprocess.run(
 174                sigrok_cmd,
 175                shell=True,
 176                check=True,
 177                capture_output=True,
 178                text=True,
 179                startupinfo=startupinfo,
 180            )
 181
 182            raw_output = process.stdout.strip()  # Get the raw output
 183
 184            # Extract only the numeric value using regex
 185            match = re.search(r"P1:\s*([\d.]+)", raw_output)  # Matches numbers with decimal points
 186            if match:
 187                self.voltcraft_vc870_temperature = float(match.group(1))  # Extracted temperature value
 188
 189    def resetFig(self, fig_2: go.Figure | None, logarithmic: bool = False, renew: bool = False) -> go.Figure:
 190        """Method to reset the plotly figure object.
 191
 192        Parameters
 193        ----------
 194        fig_2 : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 195            The plotly figure object to be modified. None when a new figure object is required.
 196        logarithmic : bool, optional
 197            Boolean indicating if the x-axis needs to be logarithmic, by default False
 198        renew : bool, optional
 199            Boolean indicating if a new plotly Figure object is needed., by default False
 200
 201        Returns
 202        -------
 203        plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 204            The plotly figure object created.
 205        """
 206        LAYOUT = {
 207            "autosize": True,
 208            "margin": {
 209                "l": 80,
 210                "r": 5,
 211                "b": 40,
 212                "t": 40,
 213            },
 214            "dragmode": "pan",
 215            "font_size": 11,
 216            "hovermode": "closest",
 217            "template": BOOTSTRAP,
 218        }
 219        if renew:
 220            fig = make_subplots(
 221                rows=2,
 222                cols=2,
 223                specs=[[{}, {}], [{"colspan": 2}, None]],
 224                subplot_titles=("Real", "Imaginary", "Cole-Cole"),
 225                vertical_spacing=0.1,
 226                figure=fig_2,
 227            )
 228        else:
 229            fig = make_subplots(
 230                rows=2,
 231                cols=2,
 232                specs=[[{}, {}], [{"colspan": 2}, None]],
 233                subplot_titles=("Real", "Imaginary", "Cole-Cole"),
 234                vertical_spacing=0.1,
 235            )
 236            """Plotly figure object for the graph area."""
 237
 238            fig = self.addFigTraces(fig)
 239
 240            fig.update_xaxes(
 241                title_text=r"$\text{Frequency [ Hz ]}$",
 242                row=1,
 243                col=1,
 244                type="log" if logarithmic else "linear",
 245            )
 246            fig.update_xaxes(
 247                title_text=r"$\text{Frequency [ Hz ]}$",
 248                row=1,
 249                col=2,
 250                type="log" if logarithmic else "linear",
 251            )
 252            fig.update_xaxes(
 253                title_text=r"$\text{Real Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
 254                # type="log",
 255                row=2,
 256            )
 257            # Update yaxis properties
 258            fig.update_yaxes(
 259                title_text=r"$\text{Real Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
 260                row=1,
 261                col=1,
 262            )
 263            fig.update_yaxes(
 264                title_text=r"$\text{Imaginary Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
 265                row=1,
 266                col=2,
 267            )
 268            fig.update_yaxes(
 269                title_text=r"$\text{Imaginary Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
 270                showgrid=False,
 271                row=2,
 272                col=1,
 273            )
 274            fig.update_layout(
 275                go.Layout(
 276                    **LAYOUT,
 277                    xaxis3={"domain": [0.25, 0.75]},
 278                    yaxis3={"anchor": "x3"},
 279                    uirevision="no_change",
 280                )
 281            )
 282
 283        return fig
 284
 285    def addFigTraces(self, fig: go.Figure, pass_no: int = 1) -> go.Figure:
 286        """Method to add new traces to a Plotly Figure object.
 287
 288
 289        Parameters
 290        ----------
 291        fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 292            The plotly figure object to which traces are to be added.
 293        pass_no : int, optional
 294            The pass number to be appended to the trace names, by default 1
 295
 296        Returns
 297        -------
 298        plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 299            The plotly figure object with the new traces.
 300        """
 301        fig.add_trace(
 302            go.Scatter(
 303                x=[],
 304                y=[],
 305                name=f"pass_{pass_no}",  # real_{pass_no}
 306                legendgroup=f"pass_{pass_no}",
 307                mode="markers+lines",
 308                line_width=1,
 309                marker_size=4,
 310            ),
 311            row=1,
 312            col=1,
 313        )
 314        fig.add_trace(
 315            go.Scatter(
 316                x=[],
 317                y=[],
 318                name=f"imag_{pass_no}",
 319                legendgroup=f"pass_{pass_no}",
 320                mode="markers+lines",
 321                line_width=1,
 322                marker_size=4,
 323                showlegend=False,
 324            ),
 325            row=1,
 326            col=2,
 327        )
 328        fig.add_trace(
 329            go.Scatter(
 330                x=[],
 331                y=[],
 332                name=f"cole_{pass_no}",
 333                legendgroup=f"pass_{pass_no}",
 334                mode="markers+lines",
 335                line_width=1,
 336                marker_size=4,
 337                showlegend=False,
 338            ),
 339            row=2,
 340            col=1,
 341        )
 342
 343        return fig
 344
 345    def updatePlotData(
 346        self,
 347        fig: go.Figure,
 348        x_data: pd.Series,
 349        y1_data: pd.Series,
 350        y2_data: pd.Series,
 351        pass_no: int,
 352    ) -> go.Figure:
 353        """Method to update trace data in a plotly Figure.
 354
 355        Parameters
 356        ----------
 357        fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 358            The plotly figure object on which the trace data is to be updated.
 359        x_data : pandas.Series
 360            The series for the x axis data for the plots in the top row. In this case the Frequency in Hz.
 361        y1_data : pandas.Series
 362            The series for the y axis data of the plot on the top-left. Usually the real part of impedance or permittivity. This will be the x axis of the plot in the bottom row.
 363        y2_data : pandas.Series
 364            The series for the y axis data of the plot on the top-right. Usually the imaginary part of the impedance or permittivity. This will be the y axis data in the bottom plot.
 365        pass_no : int
 366            Integer indicating the trace name that is to be selected to be updated.
 367
 368        Returns
 369        -------
 370        plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 371            The plotly figure with the updated trace data.
 372
 373        """
 374        fig.update_traces(
 375            overwrite=False,
 376            x=x_data,
 377            y=y1_data,
 378            selector=dict(name=f"pass_{int(pass_no)}"),  # real_{pass_no}
 379        )
 380        fig.update_traces(
 381            overwrite=False,
 382            x=x_data,
 383            y=y2_data,
 384            selector=dict(name=f"imag_{int(pass_no)}"),
 385        )
 386        fig.update_traces(
 387            overwrite=False,
 388            x=y1_data,
 389            y=y2_data,
 390            selector=dict(name=f"cole_{int(pass_no)}"),
 391        )
 392
 393        return fig
 394
 395    def startMeasurementThread(
 396        self,
 397        start_freq: float,
 398        end_freq: float,
 399        freq_step: float,
 400        logarithmic: bool,
 401        steps_per_decade: int,
 402        sample_diameter: float,
 403        sample_thickness: float,
 404        stray_capacitance: float,
 405        get_temperature: bool,
 406        no_of_passes: int,
 407        impedance: bool = True,
 408    ) -> None:
 409        """Method to start the required initialize and start the required measurement threads.
 410
 411        Parameters
 412        ----------
 413        start_freq : float
 414            The starting frequency for the measurement.
 415        end_freq : float
 416            The ending frequency for the measurement.
 417        freq_step : float
 418            The frequency steps in case of a linear sweep.
 419        logarithmic : bool
 420            Boolean indicating if the sweep needs to be logarithmic.
 421        steps_per_decade : int
 422            Integer indicating the number of steps per decade in case of a logarithmic sweep.
 423        sample_diameter : float
 424            The diameter of the sample (PVAC) in mm.
 425        sample_thickness : float
 426            The thickness of the sample (PVAC) in µm.
 427        stray_capacitance : float
 428            The stray capacitance value to be subtracted in farads.
 429        get_temperature : bool
 430            Boolean indicating if the sample temperature is to be recorded.
 431        no_of_passes : int
 432            Integer indicating the number of passes to be conducted during the measurement.
 433        impedance : bool
 434            Boolean indicating if the measruement is a Impedance mode measurement. If False the permittivity mode measurement is started.
 435
 436        """
 437        if impedance:
 438            self.meas_thread = threading.Thread(
 439                target=self.runImpedanceMeasurement,
 440                args=[
 441                    start_freq,
 442                    end_freq,
 443                    freq_step,
 444                    logarithmic,
 445                    steps_per_decade,
 446                    get_temperature,
 447                    no_of_passes,
 448                ],
 449            )
 450        else:
 451            self.meas_thread = threading.Thread(
 452                target=self.runPermittivityMeasurement,
 453                args=[
 454                    start_freq,
 455                    end_freq,
 456                    freq_step,
 457                    logarithmic,
 458                    steps_per_decade,
 459                    sample_diameter,
 460                    sample_thickness,
 461                    stray_capacitance,
 462                    get_temperature,
 463                    no_of_passes,
 464                ],
 465            )
 466
 467        if get_temperature:
 468            self.temperature_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.multimeterGetTemperature)
 469
 470        self.plot_fig = self.resetFig(self.plot_fig, logarithmic)
 471        self.meas_thread.start()
 472        self.meas_running = True
 473        self.meas_completed = False
 474        if get_temperature:
 475            self.temperature_thread.start()
 476
 477    def runImpedanceMeasurement(
 478        self,
 479        start_freq: float,
 480        end_freq: float,
 481        freq_step: float,
 482        logarithmic: bool,
 483        steps_per_decade: int,
 484        get_temperature: bool,
 485        no_of_passes: int,
 486    ) -> None:
 487        """Method for the impedance mode measurement.
 488
 489        Parameters
 490        ----------
 491        start_freq : float
 492            The starting frequency for the measurement.
 493        end_freq : float
 494            The ending frequency for the measurement.
 495        freq_step : float
 496            The frequency steps in case of a linear sweep.
 497        logarithmic : bool
 498            Boolean indicating if the sweep needs to be logarithmic.
 499        steps_per_decade : int
 500            Integer indicating the number of steps per decade in case of a logarithmic sweep.
 501        get_temperature : bool
 502            Boolean indicating if the sample temperature is to be recorded.
 503        no_of_passes : int
 504            Integer indicating the number of passes to be conducted during the measurement.
 505
 506        """
 507        if logarithmic:
 508            tot_points = (np.log10(end_freq) - np.log10(start_freq)) * steps_per_decade
 509            freqs_array = np.logspace(np.log10(start_freq), np.log10(end_freq), int(tot_points))
 510        else:
 511            tot_points = ((end_freq - start_freq) / freq_step) + 1
 512            freqs_array = [float(i) for i in np.arange(start_freq, end_freq, freq_step)]
 513            freqs_array.append(end_freq)
 514
 515        self.progress_current = 0
 516
 517        imp_z: float
 518        rad_theta: float
 519        time_stamp: str
 520
 521        self.dataframe_data = pd.DataFrame({
 522            "Time [s]": [],
 523            "Pass_No.": [],
 524            "Temperature [°]": [],
 525            "Frequency [Hz]": [],
 526            "Real Impedance [Ω]": [],
 527            "Imaginary Impedance [Ω]": [],
 528        })
 529
 530        self.plot_data_frame = pd.DataFrame({
 531            "Pass_No.": [],
 532            "Frequency [Hz]": [],
 533            "Real": [],
 534            "Imaginary": [],
 535        })
 536
 537        i = 1  # iterator for passes
 538        j = 0  # iterator for array index
 539        progress_iterator = 0
 540        self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(
 541            data_ready=1,
 542            zy_range=-1,
 543            high_speed=1,
 544            average=1,
 545            output_format=0,
 546            function_A=None,
 547            function_B=1,
 548            circuit_mode=0,
 549            trigger=0,
 550            osc_level=1.000,
 551            test_signal_freq=freqs_array[0],
 552            dc_bias=False,
 553            bias_setting=0.00,
 554            execute=True,
 555        )
 556
 557        while i <= no_of_passes:
 558            j = 0
 559            while j < len(freqs_array):
 560                if self.meas_cancelled:
 561                    break
 562                self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(
 563                    test_signal_freq=freqs_array[j],
 564                    execute=True,
 565                    sleep_adder=100,
 566                )
 567                time_stamp = time.strftime("%H:%M:%S")
 568                imp_z, rad_theta = self.hp_4192a.readFromInstrument()
 569                temperature = np.nan
 570                if get_temperature:
 571                    temperature = self.voltcraft_vc870_temperature
 572                new_data = pd.DataFrame({
 573                    "Time [s]": [time_stamp],
 574                    "Pass_No.": [i],
 575                    "Temperature [°]": [temperature],
 576                    "Frequency [Hz]": [freqs_array[j]],
 577                    "Real Impedance [Ω]": [imp_z * np.cos(rad_theta)],
 578                    "Imaginary Impedance [Ω]": [imp_z * np.sin(rad_theta)],
 579                })
 580
 581                new_plot_point = {
 582                    "Pass_No.": [i],
 583                    "Frequency [Hz]": [freqs_array[j]],
 584                    "Real": [imp_z * np.cos(rad_theta)],
 585                    "Imaginary": [imp_z * np.sin(rad_theta)],
 586                }
 587
 588                self.plot_data_frame = pd.concat([self.plot_data_frame, pd.DataFrame(new_plot_point)])
 589
 590                self.dataframe_data = pd.concat([self.dataframe_data, new_data])
 591
 592                self.data_index = len(self.dataframe_data["Time [s]"])
 593
 594                progress_iterator += 1
 595
 596                self.progress_current = int(progress_iterator * 100 / (tot_points * no_of_passes))
 597
 598                x_data = self.plot_data_frame["Frequency [Hz]"]
 599                y1_data = self.plot_data_frame["Real"]
 600                y2_data = self.plot_data_frame["Imaginary"]
 601
 602                self.plot_fig = self.updatePlotData(self.plot_fig, x_data, y1_data, y2_data, i)
 603
 604                j += 1
 605
 606            if self.meas_cancelled:
 607                self.meas_running = False
 608                self.meas_cancelled = False
 609                break
 610            i += 1
 611            self.plot_data_frame = pd.DataFrame({
 612                "Pass_No.": [],
 613                "Frequency [Hz]": [],
 614                "Real": [],
 615                "Imaginary": [],
 616            })
 617            if i <= no_of_passes:
 618                self.plot_fig = self.addFigTraces(self.plot_fig, i)
 619
 620        time.sleep(1)
 621        self.meas_running = False
 622        self.meas_completed = True
 623        self.progress_current = 100
 624        self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(data_ready=0, execute=True)
 625
 626    def runPermittivityMeasurement(
 627        self,
 628        start_freq: float,
 629        end_freq: float,
 630        freq_step: float,
 631        logarithmic: bool,
 632        steps_per_decade: int,
 633        sample_diameter: float,
 634        sample_thickness: float,
 635        stray_capacitance: float,
 636        get_temperature: bool,
 637        no_of_passes: int,
 638    ) -> None:
 639        """Method for the permittivity mode measurement.
 640
 641        Parameters
 642        ----------
 643        start_freq : float
 644            The starting frequency for the measurement.
 645        end_freq : float
 646            The ending frequency for the measurement.
 647        freq_step : float
 648            The frequency steps in case of a linear sweep.
 649        logarithmic : bool
 650            Boolean indicating if the sweep needs to be logarithmic.
 651        steps_per_decade : int
 652            Integer indicating the number of steps per decade in case of a logarithmic sweep.
 653        sample_diameter : float
 654            The diameter of the sample (PVAC) in mm.
 655        sample_thickness : float
 656            The thickness of the sample (PVAC) in µm.
 657        stray_capacitance : float
 658            The stray capacitance value to be subtracted in farads.
 659        get_temperature : bool
 660            Boolean indicating if the sample temperature is to be recorded.
 661        no_of_passes : int
 662            Integer indicating the number of passes to be conducted during the measurement.
 663
 664        """
 665        if logarithmic:
 666            tot_points = (np.log10(end_freq) - np.log10(start_freq)) * steps_per_decade
 667            freqs_array = np.logspace(np.log10(start_freq), np.log10(end_freq), int(tot_points))
 668        else:
 669            tot_points = ((end_freq - start_freq) / freq_step) + 1
 670            freqs_array = [float(i) for i in np.arange(start_freq, end_freq, freq_step)]
 671            freqs_array.append(end_freq)
 672
 673        self.progress_current = 0
 674
 675        farad: float
 676        conductivity: float
 677        capacitance_0 = (
 678            scipy.constants.epsilon_0 * (np.pi * ((sample_diameter * 1e-3) ** 2) / 4) / (sample_thickness * 1e-6)
 679        )
 680        time_stamp: str
 681
 682        self.dataframe_data = pd.DataFrame({
 683            "Time [s]": [],
 684            "Pass_No.": [],
 685            "Temperature [°]": [],
 686            "Frequency [Hz]": [],
 687            "ε'": [],
 688            'ε"': [],
 689        })
 690
 691        self.plot_data_frame = pd.DataFrame({
 692            "Pass_No.": [],
 693            "Frequency [Hz]": [],
 694            "Real": [],
 695            "Imaginary": [],
 696        })
 697
 698        i = 1  # iterator for passes
 699        j = 0  # iterator for array index
 700        progress_iterator = 0
 701        self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(
 702            data_ready=1,
 703            zy_range=-1,
 704            high_speed=1,
 705            average=1,
 706            output_format=0,
 707            function_A=3,
 708            function_B=2,
 709            circuit_mode=2,
 710            trigger=0,
 711            osc_level=1.000,
 712            test_signal_freq=freqs_array[0],
 713            dc_bias=False,
 714            bias_setting=0.00,
 715            execute=True,
 716        )
 717
 718        while i <= no_of_passes:
 719            j = 0
 720            while j < len(freqs_array):
 721                if self.meas_cancelled:
 722                    break
 723                self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(
 724                    test_signal_freq=freqs_array[j],
 725                    execute=True,
 726                    sleep_adder=100,
 727                )
 728                farad, conductivity = self.hp_4192a.readFromInstrument()
 729                time_stamp = time.strftime("%H:%M:%S")
 730                ang_freq = 2 * np.pi * freqs_array[j]
 731                temperature = np.nan
 732                if get_temperature:
 733                    temperature = self.voltcraft_vc870_temperature
 734                new_data = pd.DataFrame({
 735                    "Time [s]": [time_stamp],
 736                    "Pass_No.": [i],
 737                    "Temperature [°]": [temperature],
 738                    "Frequency [Hz]": [freqs_array[j]],
 739                    "ε'": [(farad - stray_capacitance) / capacitance_0],
 740                    'ε"': [conductivity / (ang_freq * capacitance_0)],
 741                })
 742
 743                self.new_plot_point = {
 744                    "Pass_No": i,
 745                    "Frequency [Hz]": freqs_array[j],
 746                    "Real": (farad - stray_capacitance) / capacitance_0,
 747                    "Imaginary": conductivity / (ang_freq * capacitance_0),
 748                }
 749
 750                new_plot_point = {
 751                    "Pass_No.": [i],
 752                    "Frequency [Hz]": [freqs_array[j]],
 753                    "Real": [(farad - stray_capacitance) / capacitance_0],
 754                    "Imaginary": [conductivity / (ang_freq * capacitance_0)],
 755                }
 756
 757                self.plot_data_frame = pd.concat([self.plot_data_frame, pd.DataFrame(new_plot_point)])
 758
 759                self.dataframe_data = pd.concat([self.dataframe_data, new_data])
 760
 761                self.data_index = len(self.dataframe_data["Time [s]"])
 762
 763                progress_iterator += 1
 764
 765                self.progress_current = int(progress_iterator * 100 / (tot_points * no_of_passes))
 766
 767                x_data = self.plot_data_frame["Frequency [Hz]"]
 768                y1_data = self.plot_data_frame["Real"]
 769                y2_data = self.plot_data_frame["Imaginary"]
 770
 771                self.plot_fig = self.updatePlotData(self.plot_fig, x_data, y1_data, y2_data, i)
 772
 773                j += 1
 774
 775            if self.meas_cancelled:
 776                self.meas_running = False
 777                self.meas_cancelled = False
 778                break
 779            i += 1
 780            self.plot_data_frame = pd.DataFrame({
 781                "Pass_No.": [],
 782                "Frequency [Hz]": [],
 783                "Real": [],
 784                "Imaginary": [],
 785            })
 786            if i <= no_of_passes:
 787                self.plot_fig = self.addFigTraces(self.plot_fig, i)
 788
 789        time.sleep(1)
 790        self.meas_running = False
 791        self.meas_completed = True
 792        self.progress_current = 100
 793        self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(data_ready=0, execute=True)
 794
 795    def prepareForShutdown(self) -> None:
 796        """Method called before shutting down the application."""
 797
 798        self.hp_4192a.sendCommandString(data_ready=0, execute=True)
 799        self.hp_4192a.closeConnection()
 800        os._exit(0)
 801

 806        "l": 80,
 807        "r": 5,
 808        "b": 40,
 809        "t": 40,
 810    },
 811    "dragmode": "pan",
 812    "font_size": 11,
 813    "hovermode": "closest",
 814}
 815"""Dictionary describing the layout for the plot area of the dash app."""

 818    "scrollZoom": True,
 819    "displaylogo": False,

 821        "format": "svg",
 822        "filename": "custom_image",
 823        "scale": 1,
 824    },

 826}
 827"""Dictionary describing the configuration of the plotly Figure object."""

 860"""Backend class for the measurement processing."""

 870)
 871"""The dash app variable."""

 877            html_for="switch",
 878        ),
 879        dbc.Switch(
 880            id="switch",
 881            value=True,
 882            className="d-inline-block ms-1",
 883            persistence=True,
 884        ),

 886            className="fa fa-sun",
 887            html_for="switch",
 888        ),
 889    ],
 890)
 891"""A dash html Span element for a theme switching button."""

 894    dbc.Offcanvas(
 895        dcc.Markdown(
 896            "",
 897            mathjax=True,
 898            className="offcanvas-markdown",
 899        ),
 900        id="offcanvas",
 901        title="Impedance Spectroscopy",
 902        is_open=False,

 904    ),

1254
1255@callback(
1256    Output(
1257        "sample-diameter",
1258        "disabled",
1259        allow_duplicate=True,
1260    ),
1261    Output(
1262        "sample-thickness",
1263        "disabled",
1264        allow_duplicate=True,
1265    ),
1266    Output(
1267        "stray-capacitance",
1268        "disabled",
1269        allow_duplicate=True,
1270    ),
1271    Output(
1272        "temperature-switch",
1273        "disabled",
1274        allow_duplicate=True,
1275    ),
1276    Output(
1277        "graph",
1278        "figure",
1279        allow_duplicate=True,
1280    ),
1281    Input("meas-type-select", "value"),
1282    prevent_initial_call=True,
1283)
1284def toggleMeasType(meas_mode: int) -> tuple[bool, bool, bool, bool, go.Figure | Patch]:
1285    """Method called when the measurement type is toggled.
1286
1287    Parameters
1288    ----------
1289    meas_mode : int
1290        integer indicating if the measurement is Impedance mode (0) or Permittivity mode (1).
1291
1292    Returns
1293    -------
1294    bool
1295        Boolean indicating whether the sample-diameter field is to be disabled.
1296    bool
1297        Boolean indicating whether the sample-thickness field is to be disabled.
1298    bool
1299        Boolean indicating whether the stray-capacitance field is to be disabled.
1300    bool
1301        Boolean indicating whether the temperature-switch is to be disabled.
1302    plotly.graph_objects.Figure | dash.Patch
1303        Plotly figure object or dash Patch object for the graph division of the dash app.
1304
1305    """
1306    temp_figure = data_process_backend.plot_fig
1307    patched_figure = Patch()
1308    patched_figure["layout"]["yaxis"]["title"]["text"] = (
1309        r"$\varepsilon ' $" if meas_mode else r"$\text{Real Impedance } [ \Omega ]$"
1310    )
1311
1312    patched_figure["layout"]["yaxis2"]["title"]["text"] = (
1313        r'$ \varepsilon  "$' if meas_mode else r"$\text{Imaginary Impedance } [ \Omega ]$"
1314    )
1315
1316    patched_figure["layout"]["xaxis3"]["title"]["text"] = (
1317        r"$ \varepsilon '$" if meas_mode else r"$\text{Real Impedance } [ \Omega ]$"
1318    )
1319
1320    patched_figure["layout"]["yaxis3"]["title"]["text"] = (
1321        r'$ \varepsilon "$' if meas_mode else r"$\text{Imaginary Impedance } [ \Omega ]$"
1322    )
1323
1324    temp_figure.update_layout(
1325        {
1326            "yaxis": {
1327                "title": {
1328                    "text": r"$ \varepsilon '$" if meas_mode else r"$\text{Real Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
1329                }
1330            },
1331            "yaxis2": {
1332                "title": {
1333                    "text": r'$ \varepsilon " $' if meas_mode else r"$\text{Imaginary Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
1334                }
1335            },
1336            "xaxis3": {
1337                "title": {
1338                    "text": r"$ \varepsilon '$" if meas_mode else r"$\text{Real Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
1339                }
1340            },
1341            "yaxis3": {
1342                "title": {
1343                    "text": r'$ \varepsilon "$' if meas_mode else r"$\text{Imaginary Impedance } [ \Omega ]$",
1344                }
1345            },
1346        },
1347        overwrite=False,
1348    )
1349
1350    data_process_backend.plot_fig = temp_figure
1351
1352    return (
1353        False if meas_mode else True,
1354        False if meas_mode else True,
1355        False if meas_mode else True,
1356        False if meas_mode else True,
1357        patched_figure,
1358    )
1359
1360
1361# ******************************************************************************
1362
1363
1364@callback(
1365    Output(
1366        "freq-step",
1367        "disabled",
1368        allow_duplicate=True,
1369    ),
1370    Output(
1371        "decade-step",
1372        "disabled",
1373        allow_duplicate=True,
1374    ),
1375    Output(
1376        "graph",
1377        "figure",
1378        allow_duplicate=True,
1379    ),
1380    Input("freq-sweep-select", "value"),
1381    prevent_initial_call=True,
1382)
1383def toggleFrequencySweepMode(sweep_mode: int) -> tuple[bool, bool, go.Figure | Patch]:
1384    """Method called when the frequency sweep mode is toggled.
1385
1386    Parameters
1387    ----------
1388    sweep_mode : int
1389        Integer indicating if the frequency sweeep is in linear (0) or logarithmic (1) mode.
1390
1391    Returns
1392    -------
1393    bool
1394        Boolean indicating whether the freq-step field is to be disabled.
1395    bool
1396        Boolean indicating whether the decade-step field is to be disabled.
1397    plotly.graph_objects.Figure | dash.Patch
1398        The plotly figure od dash Patch object to be sent to the graph division of the dash app.
1399
1400    """
1401    patched_figure = Patch()
1402    temp_figure = data_process_backend.plot_fig
1403
1404    patched_figure["layout"]["xaxis"]["type"] = "log" if sweep_mode else "linear"
1405    patched_figure["layout"]["xaxis2"]["type"] = "log" if sweep_mode else "linear"
1406
1407    temp_figure.update_layout(
1408        {
1409            "xaxis": {"type": "log" if sweep_mode else "linear"},
1410            "xaxis2": {"type": "log" if sweep_mode else "linear"},
1411        },
1412        overwrite=False,
1413    )
1414
1415    data_process_backend.plot_fig = temp_figure
1416
1417    if sweep_mode:
1418        return True, False, patched_figure
1419    else:
1420        return False, True, patched_figure
1421
1422

1425
1426@callback(
1427    Output("offcanvas", "is_open"),
1428    Input("open-offcanvas", "n_clicks"),
1429    State("offcanvas", "is_open"),
1430    prevent_initial_call=True,
1431)
1432def toggleOffcanvas(n1: int, is_open: bool) -> bool:
1433    """Method called when the title is clicked. It slides in a panel with information.
1434
1435    Parameters
1436    ----------
1437    n1 : int
1438        Integer indicating the number of clicks on the open-offcanvas element.
1439    is_open : bool
1440        Boolean indicating if the offcanvas element is open.
1441
1442    Returns
1443    -------
1444    bool
1445        Boolean indicating if the offcanvas element is to be opened.
1446
1447    """
1448    if n1:
1449        return not is_open
1450    return is_open
1451

1456clientside_callback(
1457    ClientsideFunction("clientside", "theme_switched"),
1458    Output("switch", "id"),
1459    Input("switch", "value"),
1460    # prevent_initial_call=True,
1461)
1462"""Method called on the clientside when the theme switch is toggled."""

1464# ********************************************************************************
1465
1466
1467@callback(
1468    Output("graph", "figure"),
1469    Input("switch", "value"),
1470    # prevent_initial_call=True,
1471)
1472def updateFigureTemplate(switch_on: int) -> go.Figure | Patch:
1473    """Method called to change the theme of the figure when the theme of the app is changed.
1474
1475    Parameters
1476    ----------
1477    switch_on : int
1478        Integer indicating the state of the switch. 0 is OFF and 1 is ON.
1479
1480    Returns
1481    -------
1482    plotly.graph_objects.Figure | dash.Patch
1483        The plotly figure or dash Patch object to be sent to the graph division of the app.
1484
1485    """
1486
1487    # When using Patch() to update the figure template, you must use the figure template dict
1488    # from plotly.io  and not just the template name
1489    # template = pio.templates["bootstrap"] if switch_on else pio.templates["bootstrap_dark"]
1490
1491    template = BOOTSTRAP if switch_on else BOOTSTRAP_DARK
1492
1493    temp_figure = data_process_backend.plot_fig
1494    patched_figure = Patch()
1495    patched_figure["layout"]["template"] = template
1496
1497    temp_figure.update_layout(dict(template=template), overwrite=False)
1498
1499    data_process_backend.plot_fig = temp_figure
1500
1501    return patched_figure
1502
1503
1504# ********************************************************************************
1505
1506
1507@callback(
1508    Input("stop-click", "n_clicks"),
1509    prevent_initial_call=True,
1510)
1511def cancelOrStopMeasurement(n: int) -> None:
1512    """Method called when the Stop button is clicked on the app.
1513
1514    Parameters
1515    ----------
1516    n : int
1517        Integer indicating the number of clicks of the stop-click button.
1518
1519    """
1520    data_process_backend.meas_cancelled = True
1521
1522
1523# ***********************************************************************************
1524
1525
1526@callback(
1527    Output(
1528        "check-running",
1529        "data",
1530        allow_duplicate=True,
1531    ),
1532    Output(
1533        "interval-component",
1534        "disabled",
1535        allow_duplicate=True,
1536    ),
1537    Input("start-click", "n_clicks"),
1538    State("meas-type-select", "value"),
1539    State("start-freq", "value"),
1540    State("end-freq", "value"),
1541    State("freq-sweep-select", "value"),
1542    State("freq-step", "value"),
1543    State("decade-step", "value"),
1544    State("sample-diameter", "value"),
1545    State("sample-thickness", "value"),
1546    State("stray-capacitance", "value"),
1547    State("temperature-switch", "value"),
1548    State("meas-passes", "value"),
1549    # background=True,
1550    prevent_initial_call=True,
1551)
1552def startMeasurement(
1553    n_clicks: int,
1554    meas_type: int,
1555    start_freq: float,
1556    end_freq: float,
1557    sweep_type: int,
1558    sweep_step: float,
1559    steps_decade: int,
1560    sample_d: float,
1561    sample_t: float,
1562    stray_Farad: float,
1563    get_temperature: bool,
1564    pass_no: int,
1565) -> tuple[bool, bool]:
1566    """Method called when the Start button is clicked.
1567
1568    Parameters
1569    ----------
1570    n_clicks : int
1571        Integer indicating the number of times the Start button was clicked.
1572    meas_type : int
1573        integer indicating the measurement mode. 0 is Impedance and 1 is Permittivity.
1574    start_freq : float
1575            The starting frequency for the measurement.
1576    end_freq : float
1577        The ending frequency for the measurement.
1578    sweep_type : int
1579        Integer indicating the sweep mode of the measurement. 0 is linear and 1 is logarithmic.
1580    sweep_step : float
1581        The frequency steps in case of a linear sweep.
1582    steps_decade : int
1583        Integer indicating the number of steps per decade in case of a logarithmic sweep.
1584    sample_d : float
1585        The diameter of the sample (PVAC) in mm.
1586    sample_t : float
1587        The thickness of the sample (PVAC) in µm.
1588    stray_Farad : float
1589        The stray capacitance value to be subtracted in farads.
1590    get_temperature : bool
1591        Boolean indicating if the sample temperature is to be recorded.
1592    pass_no : int
1593        Number of measurement passes required.
1594
1595    Returns
1596    -------
1597    bool
1598        Boolean data stored in the check-running store.
1599    bool
1600        Boolean indicating if the interval-component interval is to be disabled.
1601
1602    """
1603    logarithmic = False
1604    if sweep_type:
1605        logarithmic = True
1606    if not meas_type:
1607        # Impedance measurement mode.
1608        data_process_backend.startMeasurementThread(
1609            start_freq,
1610            end_freq,
1611            sweep_step,
1612            logarithmic,
1613            steps_decade,
1614            sample_d,
1615            sample_t,
1616            stray_Farad,
1617            get_temperature,
1618            pass_no,
1619        )
1620    else:
1621        # Permittivity measurement mode
1622        data_process_backend.startMeasurementThread(
1623            start_freq,
1624            end_freq,
1625            sweep_step,
1626            logarithmic,
1627            steps_decade,
1628            sample_d,
1629            sample_t,
1630            stray_Farad,
1631            get_temperature,
1632            pass_no,
1633            False,
1634        )
1635
1636    return True, False
1637
1638
1639# ********************************************************************************
1640
1641

1651        allow_duplicate=True,

1653    Output(
1654        "shutdown-app",
1655        "disabled",
1656        allow_duplicate=True,
1657    ),
1658    Output("meas-type-select", "options"),
1659    Output("freq-sweep-select", "options"),

1690        allow_duplicate=True,
1691    ),
1692    Output(
1693        "meas-passes",
1694        "disabled",
1695        allow_duplicate=True,
1696    ),
1697    Output(
1698        "interval-component",
1699        "disabled",
1700        allow_duplicate=True,
1701    ),
1702    Output(
1703        "save-results",
1704        "disabled",
1705        allow_duplicate=True,
1706    ),
1707    Input("check-running", "data"),
1708    State("meas-type-select", "value"),
1709    State("meas-type-select", "options"),
1710    State("freq-sweep-select", "value"),
1711    State("freq-sweep-select", "options"),
1712    prevent_initial_call=True,
1713)
1714def checkRunningProgress(
1715    running: bool,
1716    meas_mode: int,
1717    meas_type_options: dict,
1718    sweep_mode: int,
1719    sweep_type_options: dict,
1720) -> tuple[
1721    bool,
1722    bool,
1723    bool,
1724    list,
1725    list,
1726    bool,
1727    bool,
1728    bool,
1729    bool,
1730    bool,
1731    bool,
1732    bool,
1733    bool,
1734    bool,
1735    bool,
1736    bool,
1737]:
1738    """Method called when the check-running interval fires.
1739
1740    Parameters
1741    ----------
1742    running : bool
1743        Boolean indicating if the measurement is running.
1744    meas_mode : int
1745        Integer indicating the measurement type. 0 is Impedance and 1 is Permittivity mode.
1746    meas_type_options : dict
1747        Dictionary with options to the meas-type elements. Used to enable or disable the radio items for the meas mode selection.
1748    sweep_mode : int
1749        Integer indicating the sweep mode for the measurement. 0 is linear and 1 is logarithmic.
1750    sweep_type_options : dict
1751        Dictionary with options to the sweep type elements. Used to enable or disable the radio items for the sweep type selection.
1752
1753    Returns
1754    -------
1755    bool
1756        Boolean indicating if the start-click button is disabled.
1757    bool
1758        Booleann indicating if the stop-click button is disabled.
1759    bool
1760        Boolean indicating if the shutdown-app button is disabled.
1761    dict
1762        Dictionary with options to the meas-type elements. Used to enable or disable the radio items for the meas mode selection.
1763    dict
1764        Dictionary with options to the sweep-type elements. Used to enable or disable the radio items for the sweep type selection.
1765    bool
1766        Boolean indicating if the start-freq field is disabled.
1767    bool
1768        Boolean indicating if the end-freq field is disabled.
1769    bool
1770        Boolean indicating if the freq-step field is disabled.
1771    bool
1772        Booleann indicating if the decade-step field is disabled.
1773    bool
1774        Boolean indicating if the sample-diameter field is disabled.
1775    bool
1776        Boolean indicating if the sample-thickness field is disabled.
1777    bool
1778        Boolean indicating if the stray-capacitance field is disabled.
1779    bool
1780        Boolean indicating if the temperature-switch is disabled.
1781    bool
1782        Booleann indicating if the meas-passes field is disabled.
1783    bool
1784        Boolean indicating if the interval-component interval is disabled.
1785    bool
1786        Boolean indicating if the save-results button is disabled.
1787
1788    """
1789    meas_temp = list(meas_type_options)
1790    sweep_temp = list(sweep_type_options)
1791    for item in meas_temp:
1792        item["disabled"] = data_process_backend.meas_running
1793    for item in sweep_temp:
1794        item["disabled"] = data_process_backend.meas_running
1795    if running:
1796        return (
1797            True,  # disable start-click button
1798            False,  # disable stop-click button
1799            True,  # disable shutdown app button
1800            meas_temp,  # meas-type-select-options
1801            sweep_temp,  # freq-sweep-select options
1802            True,  # disable start-freq
1803            True,  # disable end-freq
1804            True,  # disable freq-step
1805            True,  # disable decade-step
1806            True,  # disable sample-diameter
1807            True,  # disable sample-thickness
1808            True,  # disable stray-capacitance
1809            True,  # disable temperature-switch
1810            True,  # disable meas-passes
1811            False,  # disable graph data process interval
1812            True,  # disable download button
1813        )
1814    else:
1815        return (
1816            False,  # disable start-click button
1817            True,  # disable stop-click button
1818            False,  # disable shutdown app button
1819            meas_temp,  # meas-type-select-options
1820            sweep_temp,  # freq-sweep-select options
1821            False,  # disable start-freq
1822            False,  # disable end-freq
1823            True if sweep_mode else False,  # disable freq-step
1824            False if sweep_mode else True,  # disable decade-step
1825            False if meas_mode else True,  # disable sample-diameter
1826            False if meas_mode else True,  # disable sample-thickness
1827            False if meas_mode else True,  # disable stray-capacitance
1828            False if meas_mode else True,  # disable temperature-switch
1829            False,  # disable meas-passes
1830            True if data_process_backend.meas_completed else False,  # disabled graph data process interval
1831            False if data_process_backend.meas_completed else True,  # disable the download button
1832        )
1833
1834
1835# ********************************************************************************
1836
1837
1838@callback(
1839    Output("progress-bar", "value"),
1840    Output("check-running", "data"),
1841    Input("progress-interval", "n_intervals"),
1842    prevent_initial_call=True,
1843)
1844def updateProgress(n: int) -> tuple[int, bool]:
1845    """Method called by the progress-interval interval component on firing.
1846
1847    Parameters
1848    ----------
1849    n : int
1850        Integer indicating the number of intervals the interval component was fired.
1851
1852    Returns
1853    -------
1854    int
1855        Integer for the current value of the progress bar.
1856    bool
1857        Boolean indicating whether the measurement is running.
1858
1859    """
1860    return data_process_backend.progress_current, data_process_backend.meas_running
1861
1862
1863# ********************************************************************************
1864
1865
1866@callback(
1867    Output(
1868        "graph",
1869        "figure",
1870        allow_duplicate=True,
1871    ),
1872    Output(
1873        "interval-component",
1874        "disabled",
1875        allow_duplicate=True,
1876    ),
1877    Input("interval-component", "n_intervals"),
1878    prevent_initial_call=True,
1879)
1880def updateGraphLive(n: int) -> tuple[go.Figure | Patch, bool]:
1881    r"""Method that is called in periodic intervals.
1882
1883    Parameters
1884    ----------
1885    n : int
1886        The iteration of the update interval.
1887
1888    Returns
1889    -------
1890    plotly.graph_objects.Figure | dash.Patch
1891        The plotly figure or dash Patch object to be sent to the graph division of the app.
1892    bool
1893        Boolean indicating if the interval-component interval is to be disabled.
1894
1895    """
1896    patched_figure = Patch()
1897    data = data_process_backend.plot_fig.to_dict()["data"]
1898    patched_figure["data"] = data
1899
1900    return patched_figure, not data_process_backend.meas_running
1901
1902

1904
1905
1906@callback(
1907    Output(
1908        "modal",
1909        "is_open",
1910        allow_duplicate=True,
1911    ),
1912    Output("save-as-file", "value"),
1913    Input("save-results", "n_clicks"),
1914    Input("cancel-save", "n_clicks"),
1915    State("modal", "is_open"),
1916    State("meas-type-select", "value"),
1917    prevent_initial_call=True,
1918)
1919def confirmFileSaveModalOpen(n1: int, n2: int, is_open: bool, meas_type: int) -> tuple[bool, str]:
1920    """Method called when the Save results button is clicked. It will open a Modal to confirm the file save.
1921
1922    Parameters
1923    ----------
1924    n1 : int
1925        Integer holding the no. of clicks on the Save button.
1926    n2 : int
1927        Integer holding the number of clicks on the Cancel button in the Modal.
1928    is_open : bool
1929        Boolean indicating if the Modal is currently open.
1930    meas_type : int
1931        Integer indicating the type of measurement conducted. 0 is impedance and 1 is permittivity.
1932
1933    Returns
1934    -------
1935    bool
1936        Boolean indicating if the Modal is to be opened.
1937    """
1938    filename_noextensions = "impedance"
1939    if meas_type:
1940        filename_noextensions = "permittivity"
1941    if n1 or n2:
1942        return not is_open, filename_noextensions
1943    return is_open, filename_noextensions
1944
1945
1946# *********************************************************************************
1947
1948
1949@callback(
1950    Output("confirm-save", "disabled"),
1951    Output("save-as-file", "valid"),
1952    Output("save-as-file", "invalid"),
1953    Input("save-as-file", "value"),
1954    prevent_initial_call=True,
1955)
1956def checkFilenameValidity(filename: str) -> tuple[bool, bool, bool]:
1957    """Method to check filename validity.
1958
1959    Parameters
1960    ----------
1961    filename : str
1962        Name of the file to be saved as.
1963
1964    Returns
1965    -------
1966    tuple[bool, bool, bool]
1967        Boolean to disabled the save button in the modal, enable valid property of the input field, enable invalid property of the input field respectively.
1968    """
1969    pattern = r'[^.\\/:*?"\'<>|]+'
1970    match = re.fullmatch(pattern, filename)
1971    if match is not None:
1972        return False, True, False
1973    else:
1974        return True, False, True
1975
1976
1977# *********************************************************************************
1978
1979
1980@callback(
1981    Output(
1982        "modal",
1983        "is_open",
1984        allow_duplicate=True,
1985    ),
1986    Input("confirm-save", "n_clicks"),
1987    State("graph", "figure"),
1988    State("save-as-file", "value"),
1989    prevent_initial_call=True,
1990)
1991def saveDataAndPlot(n_clicks: int, ex_fig: dict, filename: str) -> bool:
1992    """Method called when Save Results button is clicked.
1993
1994    Parameters
1995    ----------
1996    n_clicks : int
1997        Integer indicating the number of times the save-results button was clicked.
1998    ex_fig : dict
1999        The dictionary with the figure object of the graph area in the Dash app.
2000    filename : str
2001        The filename to save the results and plot as.
2002
2003    Returns
2004    -------
2005    bool
2006        The boolean to close the Modal.
2007    """
2008    # fig = data_process_backend.plot_fig
2009    fig = go.Figure(ex_fig)
2010    fig.write_html(
2011        filename + ".html",
2012        config=CONFIG,
2013        include_plotlyjs="cdn",
2014        include_mathjax="cdn",
2015    )
2016
2017    data_process_backend.dataframe_data.to_csv(filename + ".csv")
2018    return False
2019
